comments.body:
You are hacking incorrect behavior, please check:
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39415661/why-cant-i-import-a-class-or-function-with-import-as-x-from-y  
- https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#common-mistakes

From documentation: http://intljusticemission.github.io/react-big-calendar/examples/index.html#intro
```
import BigCalendar from 'react-big-calendar';
```
This documentation implies a Class with static methods and not a namespace.
Previous declaration was 100% correct and correctly guarded for right usage, you shouldn't be able to import by `import * as BigCalendar`, because this would lead to errors in TS projects.

To be more precise of course you still will be able to use `import * as BigCalendar`, but to use it correctly you have to access default property from namespace like this:
```
import * as BigCalendar from 'react-big-calendar'
const BigCalendarDefault = BigCalendar.default;
```

@frankwallis please remove namespace, and leave just `export = BigCalendar;`, this way it will be correct with library export and don't need the namespace hack, now you will be able to use default import with --allowSyntheticDefaultImports flag, or import with require
